net.sf.mmm.client.ui.base.widget.complex

Class AbstractUiWidgetAbstractDataTable<ADAPTER extends UiWidgetAdapterAbstractDataTable<ROW>,VALUE,ROW,ITEM_CONTAINER extends ItemContainer<ROW,ITEM_CONTAINER>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.sf.mmm.client.ui.base.feature.AbstractUiFeatureValueAndValidation<VALUE>
      • net.sf.mmm.client.ui.base.widget.AbstractUiWidget<VALUE>
        • net.sf.mmm.client.ui.base.widget.AbstractUiWidgetNative<ADAPTER,VALUE>
          • net.sf.mmm.client.ui.base.widget.AbstractUiWidgetActive<ADAPTER,VALUE>
            • net.sf.mmm.client.ui.base.widget.complex.AbstractUiWidgetAbstractDataSet<ADAPTER,VALUE,ROW,ITEM_CONTAINER>
              • net.sf.mmm.client.ui.base.widget.complex.AbstractUiWidgetAbstractDataTable<ADAPTER,VALUE,ROW,ITEM_CONTAINER>
  • Type Parameters:
    ADAPTER - is the generic type of AbstractUiWidgetNative.getWidgetAdapter().
    VALUE - is the generic type of the value. Has to be either ITEM or List<ITEM>.
    ROW - is the generic type of a row in the value list.
    ITEM_CONTAINER - is the generic type of the ItemContainer.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    AttributeReadAccessKey, AttributeReadAriaRole, AttributeReadEditable, AttributeReadEnabled, AttributeReadFocused, AttributeReadHtmlId, AttributeReadMode, AttributeReadModeFixed, AttributeReadModified, AttributeReadPrimaryStyle, AttributeReadSelectedValue<ROW>, AttributeReadSelectionMode, AttributeReadStringTitle, AttributeReadStyles, AttributeReadStylesAdvanced, AttributeReadSummary, AttributeReadTitleVisible, AttributeReadTooltip, AttributeReadValueAdvanced<VALUE>, AttributeReadVisible, AttributeReadVisibleRecursive, AttributeWriteAccessKey, AttributeWriteAriaRole, AttributeWriteEditable, AttributeWriteEnabled, AttributeWriteFocused, AttributeWriteHtmlId, AttributeWriteMode, AttributeWriteModeFixed, AttributeWriteModified, AttributeWriteOnlyFocused, AttributeWritePrimaryStyle, AttributeWriteSelectedValue<ROW>, AttributeWriteSelectionMode, AttributeWriteStringTitle, AttributeWriteStyles, AttributeWriteStylesAdvanced, AttributeWriteSummary, AttributeWriteTitleVisible, AttributeWriteTooltip, AttributeWriteValueAdvanced<VALUE>, AttributeWriteVisible, AttributeWriteVisibleAdvanced, UiFeature, UiFeatureEvent, UiFeatureFocus, UiFeatureMessages, UiFeatureMode, UiFeatureSelectedValue<ROW>, UiFeatureValidation<VALUE>, UiFeatureValue<VALUE>, UiFeatureValueAndValidation<VALUE>, UiWidgetAbstractDataSet<ROW>, UiWidgetAbstractDataTable<ROW>, UiWidget, UiWidgetAbstractComposite, UiWidgetAbstractWithValue<VALUE>, UiWidgetActive, UiWidgetRegular, UiWidgetWithSelectedValue<ROW>, AttributeReadDisposed, AttributeReadId<String>, AttributeReadTitle<String>, AttributeReadValue<VALUE>, AttributeWriteDisposed, AttributeWriteId<String>, AttributeWriteTitle<String>, AttributeWriteValue<VALUE>, Accessibility, AbstractValidatableObject, HasValueValidators<VALUE>, ValidatableObject<VALUE>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractUiWidgetAbstractListTable

    public abstract class AbstractUiWidgetAbstractDataTable<ADAPTER extends UiWidgetAdapterAbstractDataTable<ROW>,VALUE,ROW,ITEM_CONTAINER extends ItemContainer<ROW,ITEM_CONTAINER>>
extends AbstractUiWidgetAbstractDataSet<ADAPTER,VALUE,ROW,ITEM_CONTAINER>
implements UiWidgetAbstractDataTable<ROW>
    This is the abstract base implementation of UiWidgetAbstractDataTable.
    Since:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Joerg Hohwiller (hohwille at users.sourceforge.net)

      • getSelectionColumn

        public AbstractUiWidgetTableColumn<?,ROW,Boolean> getSelectionColumn()
        Gets implicit column that shows the checkboxes or radios for the selection of a row.
        ATTENTION:
        This is available for advanced flexibility. Please avoid changing title, reorderable, resizable, or sortable.
        Specified by:
        getSelectionColumn in interface UiWidgetAbstractDataTable<ROW>
        Returns:
        the implicit column that shows the checkboxes or radios for the selection of a row.

      • getRowNumberColumn

        public AbstractUiWidgetTableColumn<?,ROW,Integer> getRowNumberColumn()
        Gets implicit column that shows the row-numbers.
        ATTENTION:
        This is available for advanced flexibility. Please avoid changing title, reorderable, resizable, or sortable.
        This column may be lazily created. Only use if you want to make it visible.
        Specified by:
        getRowNumberColumn in interface UiWidgetAbstractDataTable<ROW>
        Returns:
        the implicit column that shows the row-numbers.

      • createColumn

        public <CELL> UiWidgetTableColumn<ROW,CELL> createColumn(TypedProperty<CELL> rowProperty,
                                                         UiSingleWidgetFactory<? extends UiWidgetWithValue<CELL>> widgetFactory,
                                                         Comparator<CELL> sortComparator)
        This method creates a new column for this table.
        ATTENTION:
        The column is not automatically added to the table. You need to call UiWidgetAbstractDataTable.setColumns(List) for all columns that should appear in the UI.
        Specified by:
        createColumn in interface UiWidgetAbstractDataTable<ROW>
        Type Parameters:
        CELL - is the generic type of the property type.
        Parameters:
        rowProperty - is the TypedProperty identifying which property of <ROW> to show in the column.
        widgetFactory - is the factory to create widgets for this column. ATTENTION: These widgets might be reused for performance-reasons for a different row just by setting its value. They should NOT contain additional state information (what is generally a bad idea). This parameter may be null to fall back to datatype based creation.
        sortComparator - is the sort-comparator to set.
        Returns:
        a new UiWidgetTableColumn.

      • createColumn

        public <CELL> UiWidgetTableColumn<ROW,CELL> createColumn(PropertyAccessor<ROW,CELL> rowAccessor,
                                                         UiSingleWidgetFactory<? extends UiWidgetWithValue<CELL>> widgetFactory,
                                                         Comparator<CELL> sortComparator)
        This method creates a new column for this table.
        ATTENTION:
        The column is not automatically added to the table. You need to call UiWidgetAbstractDataTable.setColumns(List) for all columns that should appear in the UI.
        Specified by:
        createColumn in interface UiWidgetAbstractDataTable<ROW>
        Type Parameters:
        CELL - is the generic type of the property value.
        Parameters:
        rowAccessor - is the PropertyAccessor to access the property of <ROW> to show in the column.
        widgetFactory - is the factory to create widgets for this column. ATTENTION: These widgets might be reused for performance-reasons for a different row just by setting its value. They should NOT contain additional state information (what is generally a bad idea). This parameter may be null to fall back to datatype based creation.
        sortComparator - is the sort-comparator to set.
        Returns:
        a new UiWidgetTableColumn.

      • createColumn

        private <CELL> UiWidgetTableColumn<ROW,CELL> createColumn(PropertyAccessor<ROW,CELL> rowAccessor,
                                                          UiSingleWidgetFactory<? extends UiWidgetWithValue<CELL>> widgetFactory,
                                                          Comparator<CELL> sortComparator,
                                                          TypedProperty<CELL> rowProperty)
        Type Parameters:
        CELL - is the generic type of the property value.
        Parameters:
        rowAccessor - is the PropertyAccessor to access the property of <ROW> to show in the column.
        widgetFactory - is the factory to create widgets for this column. ATTENTION: These widgets might be reused for performance-reasons for a different row just by setting its value. They should NOT contain additional state information (what is generally a bad idea). This parameter may be null to fall back to datatype based creation.
        sortComparator - is the sort-comparator to set.
        rowProperty - is the TypedProperty. May be null.
        Returns:
        a new UiWidgetTableColumn.
        See Also:
        createColumn(PropertyAccessor, UiSingleWidgetFactory, Comparator)

      • setColumns

        public void setColumns(List<? extends UiWidgetTableColumn<ROW,?>> columns)
        This method sets the columns for the table of this model.
        You typically will call this method like this: 
        list.setColumns(Arrays.asList(column1, column2, column3))
        Unfortunately varargs with generics cause trouble in interfaces.
        ATTENTION:
        This method should typically be called only once during initialization of this table. Multiple calls of this method for dynamic changes of the UI may NOT be completely supported by all underlying implementations. We recommend to test your code with all relevant implementations before investing in multiple dynamic changes. Consider AttributeWriteVisibleAdvanced.setVisible(boolean) instead if possible.
        Specified by:
        setColumns in interface UiWidgetAbstractDataTable<ROW>
        Parameters:
        columns - are the columns to set. Use createColumn to create before.
        See Also:
        UiWidgetAbstractDataTable.createColumn(TypedProperty, UiSingleWidgetFactory, Comparator), UiWidgetAbstractDataTable.createColumn(PropertyAccessor, UiSingleWidgetFactory, Comparator)

      • getColumnCount

        public int getColumnCount()
        Specified by:
        getColumnCount in interface UiWidgetAbstractDataTable<ROW>
        Returns:
        the number of columns that are currently set.
        See Also:
        List.size()

      • getColumn

        public UiWidgetTableColumn<ROW,?> getColumn(int index)
        This method gets the column at the given index.
        Specified by:
        getColumn in interface UiWidgetAbstractDataTable<ROW>
        Parameters:
        index - is the index of the requested column. The index corresponds to the index when the columns have been set. Reordering or hiding columns in the UI has no effect on the index. The value has to be in the range from 0 to UiWidgetAbstractDataTable.getColumnCount() - 1.
        Returns:
        the requested column.
        See Also:
        List.get(int)

      • getColumnById

        public AbstractUiWidgetTableColumn<?,ROW,?> getColumnById(String columnId,
                                                          boolean required)
                                                   throws ObjectNotFoundException
        This method gets the column with the given columnId.
        Specified by:
        getColumnById in interface UiWidgetAbstractDataTable<ROW>
        Parameters:
        columnId - is the ID of the requested column.
        required - - if true and the requested column does not exist, an exception is thrown, false otherwise (null will be returned for non existent columns).
        Returns:
        the requested column or null if no such column exists and required is false.
        Throws:
        ObjectNotFoundException - if no column exists with the given columnId and required is true.

        Parameters:

      • dragColumn

        public void dragColumn(String dragId,
                       String dropId)
        This method updates this table after a column has been dragged and dropped onto another column. It therefore moves the dragged column to the drop column.
        Parameters:
        dragId - the ID of the dragged column (that is to be moved).
        dropId - the ID of the dropped column (where to move to).

      • dragColumn

        private void dragColumn(AbstractUiWidgetTableColumn<?,ROW,?> dragColumn,
                        AbstractUiWidgetTableColumn<?,ROW,?> dropColumn)
        Parameters:
        dragColumn - the dragged column (that is to be moved).
        dropColumn - the dropped column (where to move to).
        See Also:
        dragColumn(AbstractUiWidgetTableColumn, AbstractUiWidgetTableColumn)

      • setDragOverColumn

        public AbstractUiWidgetTableColumn<?,?,?> setDragOverColumn(AbstractUiWidgetTableColumn<?,?,?> column)
        Sets the column that is currently under the dragged column.
        Note:
        For simplicity we ignore the generics here and do not require <ROW> what would actually be required for correctness.
        Parameters:
        column - is the new drag-over column. May be null.
        Returns:
        the previously stored drag-over column that is now replaced. May be null.
